lines.text: Enter GRATIANO, LORENZO, SALARINO, and SALANIO

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: Nay, we will slink away in supper-time, Disguise us at my lodging and return, All in an hour.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: We have not made good preparation.

lines.speaker: salarino
lines.text: We have not spoke us yet of torchbearers.

lines.speaker: salanio
lines.text: 'Tis vile, unless it may be quaintly order'd, And better in my mind not undertook.

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: 'Tis now but four o'clock: we have two hours To furnish us. Friend Launcelot, what's the news?
Enter LAUNCELOT, with a letter

lines.speaker: launcelot
lines.text: An it shall please you to break up this, it shall seem to signify.

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: I know the hand: in faith, 'tis a fair hand; And whiter than the paper it writ on Is the fair hand that writ.

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Love-news, in faith.

lines.speaker: launcelot
lines.text: By your leave, sir.

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: Whither goest thou?

lines.speaker: launcelot
lines.text: Marry, sir, to bid my old master the Jew to sup to-night with my new master the Christian.

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: Hold here, take this: tell gentle Jessica I will not fail her; speak it privately. Go, gentlemen, Will you prepare you for this masque tonight? I am provided of a torch-bearer.
Exit Launcelot

lines.speaker: salanio
lines.text: Ay, marry, I'll be gone about it straight. And so will I.

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: Meet me and Gratiano At Gratiano's lodging some hour hence.

lines.speaker: salarino
lines.text: 'Tis good we do so.
Exeunt SALARINO and SALANIO

lines.speaker: gratiano
lines.text: Was not that letter from fair Jessica?

lines.speaker: lorenzo
lines.text: I must needs tell thee all. She hath directed How I shall take her from her father's house, What gold and jewels she is furnish'd with, What page's suit she hath in readiness. If e'er the Jew her father come to heaven, It will be for his gentle daughter's sake: And never dare misfortune cross her foot, Unless she do it under this excuse, That she is issue to a faithless Jew. Come, go with me; peruse this as thou goest: Fair Jessica shall be my torch-beare r.
Exeunt
